result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Packer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search, treatment or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Defendant is to have no assaultive contact with C.P.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Packer

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 2.   Motion granted.   
Count 2 - Criminal damage to property (DVO) - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 3, 4, 5, & 6.   Motion granted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 08-19-22 at 1:30 p.m.   Court orders DNA sample.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Haley Kracaw, 2664 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 01-04-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of criminal damage to property as repeater, disorderly conduct (DVO) as repeater and 4 cts. felony bail jumping as repeater .  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-10-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with C.A.P., DOB: 11-17-1967 and her residence and defendant must provide an address and phone number to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 48 hours of release..  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.   
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
